title: Conham River Park Walking Route

images.title: Pierre Terre / River Avon above St Anne's Park
images.caption: River Avon above St Anne's Park. The wooded section of river below the pumping station.

images.caption: GWR arches, below Conham Ferry

images.title: Pierre Terre / River Avon, Conham
images.caption: River Avon, Conham. Looking downstream as the river swings west towards the ferry.

images.title: Martyn Pattison / Railway running alongside the river Avon, entering Bristol
images.caption: Railway running alongside the river Avon, entering Bristol

description: This pretty riverside park is located to the east of Bristol. It's a popular place for a stroll with a car park, picnic benches, woodland trails and paths along the River Avon. There's a good surfaced stone path taking you along the river to the picturesque lock and weir. Look out for flora including wild garlic and bluebells in the shady woodland. In the warmer months there's also a van selling refreshments. Just to the south you can extend your walk around the nearby Hanham Woods. The park is on the River Avon Trail so there is further scope for extending your walking on this long distance trail.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woodland trails are ideal for dog walking so you'll probably meet other owners on your visit.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just to the west you can pick up some pleasant nature trails along the Brislington Brook in the Nightingale Valley Nature Reserve.

display_address: Conham Road, Broomhill, St Anne's, Bristol, City of Bristol, West of England, England, BS15 3NY, United Kingdom
